trend_summary: Across the image series, the core riverside village slowly expanded, with scattered new houses and road extensions. Farmland dominance persists, while some forest edges were cleared for fields and a few patches near the river revegetated. Overall land-use change is modest, keeping a largely agricultural landscape with isolated settlement growth.
notable_changes: Incremental growth of the central riverside settlement, extending southward and eastward.
Emergence of ribbon housing along main roads, increasing built length but not overall density.
Conversion of several small forest blocks in the northeast to cultivated fields.
Minor reforestation and greening of riparian strips along the winding river.
Road network infill, with new local connectors linking scattered dwellings to primary routes.
